info.title: Flashcat API
info.description: Flashduty: One-stop Incident Response Platform; Nightingale: Open Source Alert Management Expert; Flashcat: Unified Observability Platform

post.description: Account is created upon invitation. Sign in to complete activation and verify phone or email to receive notifications through corresponding channels

email.title: Email Address
email.description: At least one of email or phone is required. Email must be verified to receive notifications. The system will guide users to complete or verify information upon sign in

phone.title: Phone Number
phone.description: At least one of email or phone is required. Phone number must be verified to receive notifications. The system will guide users to complete or verify information upon sign in

member_name.title: Member Name
member_name.description: Required when phone is provided; defaults to email prefix when email is provided. Member name must be unique within the account

members.title: Member List
members.description: Maximum 20 invites per request, 200 per day

member_id.title: Member ID
member_id.description: At least one of the three is required

phone.title: Member Phone
phone.description: At least one of the three is required

email.title: Member Email
email.description: At least one of the three is required

post.description: Account owner can modify all member information, each member can modify their own information

member_id.title: Member ID
member_id.description: Exactly one of the four is required

member_name.title: Member Name
member_name.description: Exactly one of the four is required

phone.title: Member Phone
phone.description: Exactly one of the four is required

email.title: Member Email
email.description: Exactly one of the four is required

phone.title: New Phone Number
phone.description: Not updated if not provided. Note: Old phone number becomes invalid immediately, new phone number must be verified to receive notifications, please proceed with caution! The system will guide users to complete or verify information upon sign in

email.title: New Email Address
email.description: Not updated if not provided. Note: Old email becomes invalid immediately, new email must be verified to receive notifications, please proceed with caution! The system will guide users to complete or verify information upon sign in

time_zone.description: Not updated if not provided. Must be in tzdata format. Please refer to [this list](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) for acceptable values.
time_zone.title: Default Timezone

updates.title: Update Content
updates.description: Fields not provided will not be updated

query.title: Search keyword
query.description: Currently only fuzzy search for member_name

person_id.title: Member ID
person_id.description: Query teams containing this member, member can be account or member

team_id.title: Team ID
team_id.description: Choose one between ID and name

team_name.title: Team Name
team_name.description: Choose one between ID and name

team_name.title: Team Name
team_name.description: Team name must be unique within the account

reset_if_name_exist.title: Update by name
reset_if_name_exist.description: If team ID is not provided but team name exists, when this value is true, the team with the same name will be updated, otherwise the update will be rejected with a duplicate name error

person_ids.title: Member ID List
person_ids.description: At least one of email, phone, or ID list is required. When multiple exist, the system will merge them

emails.title: Member Email List
emails.description: At least one of email, phone, or ID list is required. When multiple exist, the system will merge them. When an email is used by both owner and member, both will be invited to join the team

phones.title: Member Phone List
phones.description: At least one of email, phone, or ID list is required. When multiple exist, the system will merge them. When an email is used by both owner and member, both will be invited to join the team

start.title: Start time
start.description: Time automatically aligned to the previous half hour

end.title: End time
end.description: Time automatically aligned to the previous half hour, interval with start should not exceed 30 days

mode.title: Mode (Normal/Temporary)
mode.description: Rules with mode=1 are placed after those with mode=0

handoff_time.title: Handover time
handoff_time.description: Handover time in seconds from Monday 00:00 for weekly rotation cycle

restrict_mode.title: Cycle restriction mode
restrict_mode.description: 0 No restriction, 1 Daily granularity, 2 Weekly granularity

restrict_start.title: Restriction start time
restrict_start.description: Only effective for daily and weekly restriction modes. For daily mode, seconds from 00:00 of the day to restriction start time. For weekly mode, seconds from Monday 00:00 to restriction start time

restrict_end.title: Restriction end time
restrict_end.description: Only effective for daily and weekly restriction modes. For daily mode, seconds from 00:00 of the day to restriction end time. For weekly mode, seconds from Monday 00:00 to restriction end time

mode.title: Mode (Normal/Temporary)
mode.description: Rules with mode=1 are placed after those with mode=0

handoff_time.title: Handover time
handoff_time.description: Handover time in seconds from Monday 00:00 for weekly rotation cycle

restrict_mode.title: Cycle restriction mode
restrict_mode.description: 0 No restriction, 1 Daily granularity, 2 Weekly granularity

restrict_start.title: Restriction start time
restrict_start.description: Only effective for daily and weekly restriction modes. For daily mode, seconds from 00:00 of the day to restriction start time. For weekly mode, seconds from Monday 00:00 to restriction start time

restrict_end.title: Restriction end time
restrict_end.description: Only effective for daily and weekly restriction modes. For daily mode, seconds from 00:00 of the day to restriction end time. For weekly mode, seconds from Monday 00:00 to restriction end time

enumDescriptions.RequestLocked: Too many failed sensitive operations, request locked (status=423)
enumDescriptions.UndonedOrderExist: Unfinished order exists, wait for retry or contact customer service (status=409)
enumDescriptions.ResourceNotFound: Account has not purchased resources, please place order in billing center (status=400)
enumDescriptions.ReferenceExist: Associated resources exist, deletion not allowed (status=400)

time_filter.title: One-time
time_filter.description: Only one of time_filters or time_filter should be provided

time_filters.description: Only one of time_filters or time_filter should be provided
time_filters.title: Recurring

is_directly_discard.title: Whether to directly discard matching alerts

from_incident_id.title: Quick silence associated incident ID
from_incident_id.description: For quick silence, only one-time silence is allowed and the rule will be automatically deleted after expiration

time_filter.title: One-time
time_filter.description: Only one of time_filters or time_filter should be provided

repeat.title: Week mode, weekday list
repeat.description: Mutually exclusive with calendar mode parameters, only one can exist

cal_id.title: Calendar mode, calendar ID
cal_id.description: Mutually exclusive with week mode parameters, only one can exist

is_off.title: Calendar mode, whether it's a rest day

time_filters.description: Only one of time_filters or time_filter should be provided
time_filters.title: Recurring

is_directly_discard.title: Whether to directly discard matching alerts

post.description: See creation interface for filters description

equals.title: Equal items
equals.description: Items starting with labels. are label items, others are attribute items

is_directly_discard.title: Whether to directly discard matching alerts

equals.title: Equal items
equals.description: Items starting with labels. are label items, others are attribute items

post.description: See creation interface for filters description

query.title: Search keyword
query.description: Search scope: channel name and description

team_id.title: Team ID
team_id.description: Filter channels managed by this team

is_my_managed.title: My managed
is_my_managed.description: Filter channels where I am the creator or a member of the management team

is_my_starred.title: My favorites
is_my_starred.description: Filter channels in my personal favorites

is_my_team.title: My team's channels
is_my_team.description: Filter channels belonging to my teams

is_brief.title: Only return name and ID information
is_brief.description: When this parameter is specified, the system will ignore p and limit parameters and return information for all channels

post.description: See creation interface for filters description

team_id.title: Team ID
team_id.description: If not provided, only creator and owner account can manage channel configuration

plugin_ids.title: Alert event integration type ID list

is_private.title: Private access
is_private.description: Public by default if not provided

post.description: See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description

creator_id.title: Creator ID
creator_id.description: Note: If not provided means no filtering, 0 means query system presets

is_my_team.title: My team's
is_my_team.description: Filter templates belonging to my teams

post.description: See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description

incident_id.description: Preview incident ID, system mock data will be used if not provided

message.title: If failed, failure description will be returned here

post.description: See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description
See creation interface for filters description

items.description: Items starting with label. are label items, others are attribute items
Items starting with label. are label items, others are attribute items

message.title: Error description from the called party

progress.title: Processing status
progress.description: All (progress not provided), Open (progress=Triggered,Processing), Triggered (progress=Triggered), Processing (progress=Processing), Closed (progress=Closed)

responder_ids.title: Responder ID list
responder_ids.description: Responders may include assigned but unacknowledged members

start_time.title: Search range start point
start_time.description: Unit: seconds, end_time-start_time cannot exceed 1 month

end_time.title: Search range end point
end_time.description: Unit: seconds, end_time-start_time cannot exceed 1 month

range_by.title: Search time field
range_by.description: Default is last_time, supports updated_at last_time start_time. But if by_intersection=true, range_by can only be last_time or end_time

incident_severity.title: Severity
incident_severity.description: Critical,Info,Warning can have multiple values, comma separated

is_related.title: Related to me
is_related.description: Login user is creator, assignee, closer or responder

is_snoozed.title: Is snoozed
is_snoozed.description: Only check current status, not related to query time range

is_my_team.title: My team's
is_my_team.description: When set to true, only count incidents in channels belonging to my teams

$key.title: Label key with optional values, match if any value matches

labels.description: Supports exact match, regex match and wildcard match. String with '/' prefix and suffix will be treated as regex. Example: specifying ('datacenter' IN ['bj01','sh-*','']) AND ('host' IN '/api-server-\d+/') will match alerts from data centers 'bj01' and 'sh-01','sh-02' with hostname matching regex 'api-server-\d+'
labels.title: Label filters

items.description: Note: Only returns 100 items when matches exceed 100

channel_id.title: Channel ID
channel_id.description: If not provided, will be global incident requiring offline notification

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, defaults to first page if not set. Choose one between this and p parameter
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

p.title: Traditional pagination, starts from page 1 if not set, default value is 1. Choose one between this and search_after_ctx parameter
p.description: When using traditional pagination, p*limit must not exceed 10000 when p parameter is set, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

limit.title: Items per page
limit.description: When p parameter is set, (p-1)*limit must not exceed 10000, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

asc.title: Ascending order
asc.description: Default sort by incident creation time, start_time

progress.title: Processing status
progress.description: Triggered,Processing,Closed. All (progress not provided), Open (progress=Triggered,Processing), Triggered (progress=Triggered), Processing (progress=Processing), Closed (progress=Closed)

responder_ids.title: Responder ID list
responder_ids.description: Responders may include assigned but unacknowledged members

creator_ids.title: Creator ID list
creator_ids.description: 0 represents system aggregated incident, non-zero represents manually created incident

start_time.title: Search range start point
start_time.description: Unit: seconds, end_time-start_time cannot exceed 1 month

end_time.title: Search range end point
end_time.description: Unit: seconds, end_time-start_time cannot exceed 1 month

incident_severity.title: Severity
incident_severity.description: Critical,Info,Warning can have multiple values, comma separated

is_related.title: Related to me
is_related.description: Login user is creator, assignee, closer or responder

is_snoozed.title: Is snoozed
is_snoozed.description: Only check current status, not related to query time range

is_my_team.title: My team's
is_my_team.description: When set to true, only count incidents in channels belonging to my teams

is_my_channel.title: My channels
is_my_channel.description: When set to true, only count incidents in my channels (channels belonging to my teams and channels I created personally)

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, presence indicates next page exists
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

total.title: Total matching entries
total.description: Please note, total is only accurate when less than 1000, do not use this value to calculate pagination end. When total entries exceed 1000, system will only return total=1000, indicating 1000+ matches found. Please use has_next_page to determine if more data exists. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

post.description: Query similar historical incidents to the input incident, only counts similar incidents in the same channel within 30 days before the incident. Note this API is only available for Pro version.

end_time.title: End timestamp in seconds
end_time.description: When incident auto-recovers, this value is non-zero; when manually closing incident, this value may be 0

last_time.title: Start timestamp of last alert in seconds

ack_time.title: First acknowledgment timestamp in seconds
ack_time.description: If multiple people acknowledge the alert, this field is the first acknowledgment time. If acknowledgment is cancelled, this value resets to 0

close_time.title: Manual closure timestamp in seconds
close_time.description: When incident auto-recovers, the incident will also auto-close

snoozed_before.title: Snooze timestamp in seconds
snoozed_before.description: Resets to 0 when unclose or unacknowledge

incident_status.title: Incident status
incident_status.description: Enum values: Info, Warning, Critical, Ok

assigned_to.title: Assignment information
assigned_to.description: Last manual or automatic assignment information, updated when escalation or reassignment occurs

responders.title: Responder ID list
responders.description: This value has no absolute relationship with assigned_to, may be updated when someone directly acknowledges or closes the incident

data_source_id.title: Integration source
data_source_id.description: Integration source of the first alert aggregated into the incident

data_source_type.title: Integration type
data_source_type.description: Integration type of the first alert aggregated into the incident

dedup_key.title: Incident deduplication key
dedup_key.description: alert_key of the first alert aggregated into the incident

ever_muted.title: Whether has been inhibited
ever_muted.description: Whether has been silenced, converged, or inhibited

frequency.title: Trigger frequency
frequency.description: If rare, means only occurred once in 30 days. If frequent, means occurred at least 20 times in 30 days

post.description: See creation interface for filters description

items.description: Items starting with label. are label items, others are attribute items, supports integration data_source_id, alert_severity, title, alert_status
Items starting with label. are label items, others are attribute items, supports integration data_source_id, alert_severity, title, alert_status

progress.title: Processing status
progress.description:
Triggered,Closed
All (progress not provided)
Open (progress=Triggered)
Closed (progress=Closed)

title.title: Title filter
title.description: Supports exact match, regex match and wildcard match. String with '/' prefix and suffix will be treated as regex. Example: specifying ('datacenter' IN ['bj01','sh-*','']) AND ('host' IN '/api-server-\d+/') will match alerts from data centers 'bj01' and 'sh-01','sh-02' with hostname matching regex 'api-server-\d+'

start_time.title: Start timestamp
start_time.description: This time is query's start_time, not related to alert's start_time. Actual search condition is: alert.start_time<=query.end_time and alert.last_time>=query.start_time

end_time.title: End time
end_time.description: This time is query's end_time, not related to alert's end_time. Actual search condition is: alert.start_time<=query.end_time and alert.last_time>=query.start_time

alert_severity.title: Severity
alert_severity.description: Critical, Info, Warning supports multiple values, comma separated

is_my_channel.title: My channels only
is_my_channel.description: Only filter alerts from channels related to me

ever_muted.description: Not provided means query all, true means only return silenced or inhibited alerts, false means only return alerts never inhibited
ever_muted.title: Whether has been silenced/inhibited

items.description: Note: Only returns 100 items when matches exceed 100

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, defaults to first page if not set. Choose one between this and p parameter
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

p.title: Traditional pagination, starts from page 1 if not set, default value is 1. Choose one between this and search_after_ctx parameter
p.description: When using traditional pagination, p*limit must not exceed 10000 when p parameter is set, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

limit.title: Items per page
limit.description: When p parameter is set, (p-1)*limit must not exceed 10000, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

asc.title: Ascending order
asc.description: Default sort by created_at in descending order

orderby.title: Sort field
orderby.description: Supports created_at updated_at, default is created_at

title.title: Title filter
title.description: Supports exact match, regex match and wildcard match. String with '/' prefix and suffix will be treated as regex. Example: specifying ('datacenter' IN ['bj01','sh-*','']) AND ('host' IN '/api-server-\d+/') will match alerts from data centers 'bj01' and 'sh-01','sh-02' with hostname matching regex 'api-server-\d+'

progress.title: Processing status
progress.description:
Triggered,Closed
All (progress not provided)
Open (progress=Triggered)
Closed (progress=Closed)

alert_severity.title: Severity
alert_severity.description: Critical, Info, Warning supports multiple values, comma separated

ever_muted.title: Whether has been silenced/inhibited
ever_muted.description: Not provided means query all, true means only return silenced or inhibited alerts, false means only return alerts never inhibited

start_time.title: Start timestamp
start_time.description: This time is query's start_time, not related to alert's start_time. Actual search condition is: alert.start_time<=query.end_time and alert.last_time>=query.start_time

end_time.title: End time
end_time.description: This time is query's end_time, not related to alert's end_time. Actual search condition is: alert.start_time<=query.end_time and alert.last_time>=query.start_time

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, presence indicates next page exists
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

total.title: Total matching entries
total.description: Please note, total is only accurate when less than 1000, do not use this value to calculate pagination end. When total entries exceed 1000, system will only return total=1000, indicating 1000+ matches found. Please use has_next_page to determine if more data exists. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

post.description: This interface only handles merging into an existing incident. For creating new incidents, please use the 'Create Incident' interface in Incident Management
Maximum time span supported is 6 months
Maximum time span supported is 6 months
Supports maximum 30 days data aggregation

incident_mttr_past_1st_week.title: MTTR for incidents in the first week of the past

incident_mttr_past_2nd_week.title: MTTR for incidents in the second week of the past

incident_mtta_past_1st_week.title: MTTA for incidents in the first week of the past

incident_mtta_past_2nd_week.title: MTTA for incidents in the second week of the past

incident_cnt_past_1st_week.title: Number of incidents in the first week of the past

incident_cnt_past_2nd_week.title: Number of incidents in the second week of the past

incident_auto_cnt_past_1st_week.title: Number of auto-created incidents in the first week of the past

incident_auto_cnt_past_2nd_week.title: Number of auto-created incidents in the second week of the past

incident_acked_cnt_past_1st_week.title: Number of acknowledged incidents in the first week of the past

incident_acked_cnt_past_2nd_week.title: Number of acknowledged incidents in the second week of the past

alert_cnt_past_1st_week.title: Number of alerts in the first week of the past

alert_cnt_past_2nd_week.title: Number of alerts in the second week of the past

alert_event_cnt_past_1st_week.title: Number of alert events in the first week of the past

alert_event_cnt_past_2nd_week.title: Number of alert events in the second week of the past

step.title: Statistics cycle
step.description: Day, Week, Month, supports maximum 31 points

step.title: Statistics cycle
step.description: Day, Week, Month, supports maximum 31 points

post.description: Supports maximum 30 days data aggregation
Maximum time span supported is 6 months

channel_ids.title: Channel list
channel_ids.description: Empty means query all, 0 means query global incidents, in this case alert and event counts will not be returned

post.description: See creation interface for filters description

options.title: Optional values
options.description: Array elements must be unique and type must match value_type definition

options.title: Optional values
options.description: Array elements must be unique and type must match value_type definition

kind.title: Calendar type, defaults to personal, must be specified to get holidays

day.title: Day
day.description: Defaults to not set, must set month when setting this

cal_id.title: Calendar ID
cal_id.description: Can only get details of personal type calendars

team_id.title: Team ID, if 0 means only creator and owner account can modify configuration

timezone.title: Calendar timezone, format requirement: must match timezone definition in IANA Time Zone Database

items.description: Sunday=0

workdays.title: Working day list, empty list means all days are working days. Enum values 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 represent Monday to Sunday

extra_cal_ids.title: Associated calendar ID list, like mainland China statutory holidays

is_off.title: Is rest day, false means working day

team_id.title: Team ID, if 0 means only creator and owner account can modify configuration

timezone.title: Calendar timezone, format requirement: must match timezone definition in IANA Time Zone Database
timezone.description: Example value: "Asia/Shanghai" Default value: "Asia/Shanghai", not updated if not provided

items.description: Sunday=0

workdays.title: Working day list, empty list means all days are working days. Enum values 1,2,3,4,5,6,7 represent Monday to Sunday

extra_cal_ids.title: Associated calendar ID list, like mainland China statutory holidays

post.description: Each account is allowed to create maximum 10 schemas
Each schema allows maximum 10,000 data entries

parameters.name: do_not_truncate_first
parameters.description: Whether to clear data first, defaults to clear

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, defaults to first page if not set. Choose one between this and p parameter
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

p.title: Traditional pagination, starts from page 1 if not set, default value is 1. Choose one between this and search_after_ctx parameter
p.description: When using traditional pagination, p*limit must not exceed 10000 when p parameter is set, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

limit.title: Items per page
limit.description: When p parameter is set, (p-1)*limit must not exceed 10000, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, presence indicates next page exists
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

total.title: Total matching entries
total.description: Please note, total is only accurate when less than 1000, do not use this value to calculate pagination end. When total entries exceed 1000, system will only return total=1000, indicating 1000+ matches found. Please use has_next_page to determine if more data exists. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

rules.title: Rule list
rules.description: Rules will be executed in order

kind.title: Rule type
kind.description: Rules will be executed in order

settings.title: Rule configuration
settings.description: Different configurations for different rule types

default.title: Default route
default.description: Must provide either this or conditional route

cases.title: Conditional route
cases.description: Must provide either this or default route

start_time.title: Start time
start_time.description: Timestamp in seconds, incident trigger time must be greater than this

end_time.title: End time
end_time.description: Timestamp in seconds, incident trigger time must be less than or equal to this. Maximum time span is 6 months, if aggregate_unit is day, maximum time span is 31 days.

time_zone.title: Default timezone Asia/Shanghai, used for results and grouping timezone. Must be in tzdata format. Please refer to [this list](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) for acceptable values.

asc.title: Ascending order
asc.description: Result sort order; true means ascending, false means descending, default is descending.

aggregate_unit.title: Data granularity
aggregate_unit.description: Time unit for aggregating metrics. If no value provided, metrics will be aggregated for the entire period.

split_hours.title: Whether to distinguish time
split_hours.description: If yes, metrics will be aggregated by work time, rest time and sleep time

total_engaged_seconds.description: Total time spent by responders participating in incident processing. One person's processing time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
total_engaged_seconds.title: Total responder response time

mean_seconds_to_engage.description: Average processing time, one person's processing time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
mean_seconds_to_engage.title: Average processing time

ts.title: Phase start time
ts.description: Timestamp in seconds, whether to display depends on if data is aggregated by time granularity. When aggregate_unit is day, this value will be set to timestamp of day start (00:00) according to time_zone

hours.title: Time type
hours.description: Define each hour as one of work time, rest time or sleep time. To distinguish metric differences between different time periods. When not filtering by time period, this field is not displayed. An incident's time type is only determined by its occurrence time, even if the incident spans multiple time types, it will not be split.

channel_id.title: Channel ID
channel_id.description: Channel ID, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

channel_name.title: Channel name
channel_name.description: Channel name, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

team_id.title: Team ID
team_id.description: Team ID, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

team_name.title: Team name
team_name.description: Team name, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

fire_type.title: Notification type, enum values: fire: notification, refire: loop notification

persons.title: Direct message target list
persons.description: Must exist when by=sms/email/voice, may exist when by=feishu_app/wecom_app/dingtalk_app

person_ids.title: Direct assigned member list
person_ids.description: Choose one between this and escalation rule

escalate_rule_id.title: Escalation rule ID
escalate_rule_id.description: Choose one between this and assigned members

layer_idx.title: Assignment level
layer_idx.description: When assigning to a rule, can specify the assignment level

layer_person_reset.title: Level member replacement
layer_person_reset.description: When assigning to a rule, can set different level members simultaneously

team_ids.description: At least one of team_ids, person_ids and schedule_to_role_ids must be provided

schedule_to_role_ids.title: Schedule ID and role ID list
schedule_to_role_ids.description: At least one of team_ids, person_ids and schedule_to_role_ids must be provided

person_ids.title: Direct assigned member list
person_ids.description: Choose one between this and escalation rule

escalate_rule_id.title: Escalation rule ID
escalate_rule_id.description: Choose one between this and assigned members

layer_idx.title: Assignment level

layer_person_reset.title: Level member replacement

enumDescriptions.RequestLocked: Too many failed sensitive operations, request locked (status=423)
enumDescriptions.UndonedOrderExist: Unfinished order exists, wait for retry or contact customer service (status=409)
enumDescriptions.ResourceNotFound: Account has not purchased resources, please place order in billing center (status=400)
enumDescriptions.ReferenceExist: Associated resources exist, deletion not allowed (status=400)

team_id.title: Team ID
team_id.description: Team members have edit permission for channel

is_private.title: Private access
is_private.description: If yes, only channel creator, channel team members and account administrators can access

active_incident_highest_severity.title: Highest severity of active incidents
active_incident_highest_severity.description: Field is empty or not returned if no active incidents

enumDescriptions.i: intelligent, use intelligent algorithm for grouping
enumDescriptions.p: pattern, use custom rules for grouping

cases.title: Branch grouping dimensions
cases.description: Only exists when using pattern grouping. Match branch conditions from top to bottom in priority, use branch dimensions for grouping when matched

items.description: Length not exceeding 5
OR relationship between sets, AND relationship within set

equals.title: Default grouping dimensions
equals.description: Only exists when using pattern grouping. If no branch matches, use these dimensions as fallback. Note these are multiple sets of grouping dimensions, alerts will be grouped if any set of dimensions matches

all_equals_required.title: Whether equal items must all exist
all_equals_required.description: Only exists when using pattern grouping. Defaults to false. The difference when configuring multiple equal items: - When enabled, grouping conditions where values are both empty in alert and incident will be treated as different items. - When disabled, grouping conditions where values are both empty in alert and incident will be treated as same items.

time_window.title: Time window in minutes, range [0,60]
time_window.description: 0 means keep merging alerts until incident closes

storm_threshold.title: Storm threshold, trigger storm warning when aggregated alert count exceeds this value. Range [0,10000]

items.description: Inner conditions

AndFilters.description: Outer conditions, AND relationship between conditions

key.title: Attribute or label
key.description: Items prefixed with labels. are labels, others are attributes, like title, severity, description etc.

oper.title: Operation type
oper.description: Supports equals: IN, not equals: NOTIN

vals.title: Value range
vals.description: When oper=IN, match succeeds if any value matches; when oper=NOTIN, match fails if any value doesn't match. Label values support exact (string), regex (string with '/' prefix and suffix) and wildcard (string containing '*' and '?' but not regex) matching. Example: You can specify ('datacenter' IN ['bj01','sh-*','']) AND ('host' IN '/api-server-\d+/') to associate alerts from data centers 'bj01' and 'sh-01','sh-02' with hostname matching regex 'api-server-\d+'

max_changes.title: Maximum occurrence count of same incident within time window

enumDescriptions.i: intelligent, use intelligent algorithm for grouping
enumDescriptions.p: pattern, use custom rules for grouping

max_changes.description: Range [2,100], default 4. When dedup_key is same, incidents are considered same. dedup_key comes from alert_key of first merged alert

creator_id.title: Creator ID
creator_id.description: If no one in responsible team, can only rely on creator for management

rule_id.title: If 0, only creator and owner account can modify configuration

description.title: Array elements must be unique and type must match value_type definition

rule_id.title: Responsible team ID, if 0 means only creator and owner account can modify configuration

start.title: Calendar timezone, format requirement: must match timezone definition in IANA Time Zone Database

items.description: Wednesday

repeat.title: Week mode, weekday list
repeat.description: Mutually exclusive with calendar mode parameters, only one can exist

cal_id.title: Calendar mode, calendar ID
cal_id.description: Mutually exclusive with week mode parameters, only one can exist

is_off.title: Calendar mode, whether it's a rest day

is_directly_discard.title: Whether to directly discard matching alerts, default keep

is_effective.title: Whether effective
is_effective.description: Check if current time meets time conditions

repeat.title: Week mode, weekday list
repeat.description: Mutually exclusive with calendar mode parameters, only one can exist

cal_id.title: Calendar mode, calendar ID
cal_id.description: Mutually exclusive with week mode parameters, only one can exist

is_off.title: Calendar mode, whether it's a rest day

equals.title: Equal items
equals.description: Items prefixed with label. are labels, others are attributes

is_directly_discard.title: Whether to directly discard matching alerts

equals.title: Equal items
equals.description: Items prefixed with labels. are labels, others are attributes, supports integration data_source_id, severity alert_severity, title, alert status alert_status

alert_key.title: Event correlation basis
alert_key.description: Alerts with same alert_key will be merged into one alert

start_time.title: First trigger time
start_time.description: Alert may frequently occur and recover, this is the first trigger time

last_time.title: Last merged event time
last_time.description: Only updated when merging new alert events, different from updated_at

end_time.title: Alert end time
end_time.description: Updated when alert recovers. For auto-recovery, alert will auto-close and close_time will be updated simultaneously

close_time.title: Manual closure time
close_time.description: Closure does not affect alert recovery

created_at.title: Created time
created_at.description: Database record creation time, generally same as start_time

updated_at.title: Updated time
updated_at.description: Database record update time, different from last_time, this field will be updated for both manual and automatic alert updates

^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$.title: key can be any label name, value is string
^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$.description: label format must match regex ^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$, value length must not exceed 512 bytes

end_time.title: End timestamp in seconds
end_time.description: When incident auto-recovers, this value is non-zero; when manually closing incident, this value may be 0

last_time.title: Start timestamp of last alert in seconds

ack_time.title: First acknowledgment timestamp in seconds
ack_time.description: If multiple people acknowledge the alert, this field is the first acknowledgment time. If acknowledgment is cancelled, this value resets to 0

close_time.title: Manual closure timestamp in seconds
close_time.description: When incident auto-recovers, the incident will also auto-close

snoozed_before.title: Snooze timestamp in seconds
snoozed_before.description: Resets to 0 when unclose or unacknowledge

incident_status.title: Incident status
incident_status.description: Enum values: Info, Warning, Critical, Ok

assigned_to.title: Assignment information
assigned_to.description: Last manual or automatic assignment information, updated when escalation or reassignment occurs

responders.title: Responder ID list
responders.description: This value has no absolute relationship with assigned_to, may be updated when someone directly acknowledges or closes the incident

data_source_id.title: Integration source
data_source_id.description: Integration source of first alert aggregated into the incident

data_source_type.title: Integration type
data_source_type.description: Integration type of first alert aggregated into the incident

dedup_key.title: Incident deduplication key
dedup_key.description: alert_key of first alert aggregated into the incident

ever_muted.title: Whether has been inhibited
ever_muted.description: Whether has been silenced, converged, or inhibited before

frequency.title: Trigger frequency
frequency.description: If rare, means only occurred once in 30 days. If frequent, means occurred at least 20 times in 30 days

acknowledged_at.title: Acknowledgment time
acknowledged_at.description: 0 means this person has not acknowledged

detail.title: Operation details
detail.description: Each type corresponds to different content, please parse according to operation type

time_zone.description: Must be in tzdata format. Please refer to [this list](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) for acceptable values.
time_zone.title: Default timezone

mode.title: Mode (Normal/Temporary)
mode.description: Rules with mode=1 are placed after those with mode=0

handoff_time.title: Handover time
handoff_time.description: Handover time in seconds from Monday 00:00 for weekly rotation cycle

restrict_mode.title: Cycle restriction mode
restrict_mode.description: 0 No restriction, 1 Daily granularity, 2 Weekly granularity

restrict_start.title: Restriction start time
restrict_start.description: Only effective for daily and weekly restriction modes. For daily mode, seconds from 00:00 of the day to restriction start time. For weekly mode, seconds from Monday 00:00 to restriction start time

restrict_end.title: Restriction end time
restrict_end.description: Only effective for daily and weekly restriction modes. For daily mode, seconds from 00:00 of the day to restriction end time. For weekly mode, seconds from Monday 00:00 to restriction end time

escalate_window.title: Minutes before escalating to next window

force_escalate.title: Whether to force escalation
force_escalate.description: By default incident won't escalate after acknowledgment, set to true to escalate even after acknowledgment

team_ids.title: Team ID list
team_ids.description: At least one of team_ids, person_ids and schedule_to_role_ids must be provided

person_ids.title: Member ID list
person_ids.description: At least one of team_ids, person_ids and schedule_to_role_ids must be provided

schedule_to_role_ids.title: Schedule ID and role ID list
schedule_to_role_ids.description: At least one of team_ids, person_ids and schedule_to_role_ids must be provided

by.title: Personal channels
by.description: At least one of this and webhooks must be provided

items.description: SMS, voice, email, push or specific IM integration
SMS, voice, email, push or specific IM integration
SMS, voice, email, push or specific IM integration

webhooks.title: Group chat channels
webhooks.description: At least one of this and by must be provided

items.description: SMS, voice, email, push or specific IM integration
SMS, voice, email, push or specific IM integration
SMS, voice, email, push or specific IM integration

options.title: Optional values
options.description: Array elements must be unique and type must match value_type definition

team_id.title: Management team ID, if 0 means only creator and owner account can modify configuration

timezone.title: Calendar timezone, format requirement: must match timezone definition in IANA Time Zone Database

extra_cal_ids.title: Associated calendar ID list, like mainland China statutory holidays

creator_id.title: Creator ID
creator_id.description: May be empty for public holidays

is_off.title: Is rest day, false means working day

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, defaults to first page if not set. Choose one between this and p parameter
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

p.title: Traditional pagination, starts from page 1 if not set, default value is 1. Choose one between this and search_after_ctx parameter
p.description: When using traditional pagination, p*limit must not exceed 10000 when p parameter is set, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

limit.title: Items per page
limit.description: When p parameter is set, (p-1)*limit must not exceed 10000, otherwise returns parameter error. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

search_after_ctx.title: Cursor pagination, presence indicates next page exists
search_after_ctx.description: For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

total.title: Total matching entries
total.description: Please note, total is only accurate when less than 1000, do not use this value to calculate pagination end. When total entries exceed 1000, system will only return total=1000, indicating 1000+ matches found. Please use has_next_page to determine if more data exists. For detailed explanation, please refer to [About Pagination](https://developer-en.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/open-api/about-pagination)

override.title: Whether to overwrite if result label already exists

pattern.title: Extract regex
pattern.description: Must be valid regex; at least one submatch required, if multiple submatches found, join with space; mutually exclusive with g_json

g_json.title: gjson path
g_json.description: gjson path syntax, please refer to [gjson.dev](https://gjson.dev) for specific syntax; note this is mutually exclusive with pattern

kind.title: Rule type
kind.description: Rules will be executed in order

result_labels.title: Label list to generate
result_labels.description: Must be result fields defined in mapping table

override.title: Whether to overwrite if result label already exists

template.title: Composition rule
template.description: A format string that allows variables, variable names in form ${label} where label is source label name

override.title: Whether to overwrite if result label already exists

cases.title: Conditional route
cases.description: At least one of this and default route must exist

default.title: Default route
default.description: At least one of this and conditional route must exist

detail.title: Operation details
detail.description: Each type corresponds to different content, please parse according to operation type

kind.title: Rule type
kind.description: Rules will be executed in order

if.title: Filter conditions, empty means match all

settings.title: Rule configuration
settings.description: Different configurations for different rule types

equals.description: Items prefixed with label. are labels, others are attributes
equals.title: Equal items

severity.title: New severity
severity.description: Supports variable generation, refer to [Customize Incident Description](https://docs.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/customize-incident-attrs)

description.title: New alert description
description.description: Supports variable generation, refer to [Customize Incident Description](https://docs.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/customize-incident-attrs)

title.title: New alert title
title.description: Supports variable generation, refer to [Customize Incident Title](https://docs.flashcat.cloud/en/flashduty/customize-incident-attrs)

start_time.title: Start time
start_time.description: Timestamp in seconds, incident trigger time must be greater than this

end_time.title: End time
end_time.description: Timestamp in seconds, incident trigger time must be less than or equal to this. Maximum time span is 6 months, if aggregate_unit is day, maximum time span is 31 days.

time_zone.title: Timezone
time_zone.description: Default timezone Asia/Shanghai, used for results and grouping timezone. Must be in tzdata format. Please refer to [this list](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) for acceptable values.

total_engaged_seconds.description: Total time spent by responders participating in incident processing. One person's processing time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
total_engaged_seconds.title: Total responder response time

mean_seconds_to_engage.description: Average processing time, one person's processing time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
mean_seconds_to_engage.title: Average processing time

ts.title: Phase start time
ts.description: Timestamp in seconds, whether to display depends on if data is aggregated by time granularity. When aggregate_unit is day, this value will be set to timestamp of day start (00:00) according to time_zone

hours.title: Time type
hours.description: Define each hour as one of work time, rest time or sleep time. To distinguish metric differences between different time periods. When not filtering by time period, this field is not displayed. An incident's time type is only determined by its occurrence time, even if the incident spans multiple time types, it will not be split.

channel_id.title: Channel ID
channel_id.description: Channel ID, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

channel_name.title: Channel name
channel_name.description: Channel name, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

team_id.title: Team ID
team_id.description: Team ID, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

team_name.title: Team name
team_name.description: Team name, grouping data, may or may not exist depending on grouping situation

total_engaged_seconds.description: Total time spent by responders participating in incident processing. One person's processing time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
total_engaged_seconds.title: Total processing time

mean_seconds_to_engage.description: Average processing time. One person's processing time is the time difference from acknowledgment to incident closure (close_time-ack_time), may include snooze time. If no one acknowledges, this value is 0.
mean_seconds_to_engage.title: Average processing time

ts.title: Phase start time
ts.description: Timestamp in seconds, whether to display depends on if data is aggregated by time granularity. When aggregate_unit is day, this value will be set to timestamp of day start (00:00) according to time_zone
